action.action-desc: Mr. McKinley (for himself, Ms. Sinema, and Ms. Titus) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Veterans' Affairs

form.official-title: To amend title 38, United States Code, to authorize the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to provide additional educational assistance benefits under the Post-9/11 Educational Assistance Program of the Department of Veterans Affairs to certain eligible individuals.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the GI Bill STEM Extension Act of 2017.

section.header: Additional educational assistance under Post-9/11 Educational Assistance Program of Department of Veterans Affairs

subsection.text: Subchapter II of chapter 33 of title 38, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following new section:
Subject to the limitation under subsection (f), the Secretary shall provide additional benefits to eligible individuals selected by the Secretary under this section.
For purposes of this section, an eligible individual is an individual—

paragraph.text: who is or was entitled to educational assistance under section 3311 of this title;
who has used all of the educational assistance to which the individual is entitled under this chapter;
who applies for assistance under this section; and

subparagraph.text: is enrolled in a program of education leading to a post-secondary degree that requires more than the standard 128 semester (or 192 quarter) credit hours for completion in—

clause.text: computer and information science and support services;
engineering technologies or an engineering-related field;
a health profession or related program; or

subparagraph.text: has earned a post-secondary degree in a field referred to in subparagraph (A) and is enrolled in a program of education leading to a teaching certification.

subsection.text: In selecting eligible individuals to receive additional benefits under this section, the Secretary shall give priority to the following individuals:

paragraph.text: Individuals who require the most credit hours described in subsection (b)(4).
Individuals who are entitled to educational assistance under this chapter by reason of paragraph (1) or (2) of section 3311(b) of this title.

subsection.text: The Secretary shall pay to each eligible individual who receives additional benefits under this section a one-time, lump sum payment that is the lesser of the following amounts (adjusted with respect to the individual pursuant to paragraphs (2) through (7) of section 3313(c), as appropriate):

paragraph.text: The amount payable under section 3313 of this title for nine months of the program of education in which the individual is enrolled.

subsection.text: An individual who receives additional benefits under this section may not transfer any amount of such additional benefits under section 3319 of this title.
The total amount of benefits paid to all eligible individuals under this section may not exceed $100,000,000 for any fiscal year.
